channel.title: [Delta] Website Integrated Player Shop System! [In-Progress]
channel.description:
I was thinking of some cool projects I could do that no one else has tried before, so I thought of something great. Most servers have the standard player shops where you right click someone and click 'View Shop'. I'm doing something like that except players talk to an NPC and give the NPC items to add the the, 'Auction House', the player says a price for the item, and whether or not to have it just a buy for a set price, or people to auction for it. Currently I have it displaying a players inventory on the site, with images, it's real time and updates instantly. Below is a video showing the process.. [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uyJy1afgZGI[/youtube]
I'm going to change this later on to read the information from what the user is selling, upon someone purchasing it on the site, it takes money from the buyers inventory, and sends it to the sellers inventory, then gives the buyer their item they have purchases, if there were no problems with the transaction. Most of the stuff is going to be done website sided with Javascript/PHP/SQL, just recently I've added switching between Item IDs and Images (for my personal debugging purposes), and grouping. So in the shop you can choose to shop by type, say you select runes (show in the picture below) it'll get all of the runes for sale and display them to you with options to purchase and compare prices, etc. [img]http://i49.tinypic.com/2v82ws1.png[/img]
Update Log: [code] - Have Inventory save to Database. - Have Player Inventories viewable with inventory.php?username=USERNAME. - Added over 2000 item images and coordinated them. - Created Item information, and ItemID will pull the item image, name, requirements, etc. - Worked out the basic functioning of the shopping system. - Created item categories and grouping. [/code]
Coming Soon: [code] - Actual shopping on the website system. - Auctioning items. - "Store" pages on the site, players join a store that can be justified to one category of item selling. - Integration with SMF and Vbulletin forums (view someones shop on their profile) - Searching through items efficiently. - Tons of other nice features. [/code]
You all can help by letting me know what you think, and providing suggestions if any come to mind. I'm going a bit slower paced as I'm still learning some Java and not fully advanced with it as I am with PHP. Let me know if you have suggestions on ways I could improve the development of this system. - The Web Guy
[b][u][size=12pt]I hope to release this to Moparscape as a tutorial in the next month or so.[/size][/u][/b]

item.title: [Delta] Website Integrated Player Shop System! [In-Progress]
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:9, topic:464152”]Probably one of the best ideas I’ve seen in quite some time.

What are you using to integrate it into the server? Will all your item’s “cost” be stored in a SQL database, so both the site and server can pull info from them and/or modify it?

Anyways, I wish you luck with this.[/quote]

Players pre-define their own prices that are displayed on the website, the prices will be logged in SQL Databases, I’m working on a script involving tons of math that will accurately give an average item price.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Website Integrated Player Shop System! [In-Progress]
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

Probably one of the best ideas I’ve seen in quite some time.

What are you using to integrate it into the server? Will all your item’s “cost” be stored in a SQL database, so both the site and server can pull info from them and/or modify it?

Anyways, I wish you luck with this.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Website Integrated Player Shop System! [In-Progress]
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:6, topic:464152”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=567986.msg4124785#msg4124785 date=1350247259]
Yet another great idea, AJ good luck.
[/quote]

Thanks my friend![/quote]

I linked a currency system with my forums to my game before and people loved that so I’m sure they’ll love this more or less the more they posted the more money they got ingame (the economy was shit, it was a 667). The forums were dead and I had to get them active somehow. Although, this beats my idea

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Website Integrated Player Shop System! [In-Progress]
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Null Amount:

Does the player need to log out before it updates?

Nope, upon exiting the NPC interface where they give the NPC items, it’s automatically saved.

item.title: [Delta] Website Integrated Player Shop System! [In-Progress]
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

I was thinking of some cool projects I could do that no one else has tried before, so I thought of something great. Most servers have the standard player shops where you right click someone and click ‘View Shop’. I’m doing something like that except players talk to an NPC and give the NPC items to add the the, ‘Auction House’, the player says a price for the item, and whether or not to have it just a buy for a set price, or people to auction for it. Currently I have it displaying a players inventory on the site, with images, it’s real time and updates instantly. Below is a video showing the process…
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uyJy1afgZGI[/youtube]

I’m going to change this later on to read the information from what the user is selling, upon someone purchasing it on the site, it takes money from the buyers inventory, and sends it to the sellers inventory, then gives the buyer their item they have purchases, if there were no problems with the transaction. Most of the stuff is going to be done website sided with Javascript/PHP/SQL, just recently I’ve added switching between Item IDs and Images (for my personal debugging purposes), and grouping. So in the shop you can choose to shop by type, say you select runes (show in the picture below) it’ll get all of the runes for sale and display them to you with options to purchase and compare prices, etc.

Update Log:

- Have Inventory save to Database.
- Have Player Inventories viewable with inventory.php?username=USERNAME.
- Added over 2000 item images and coordinated them.
- Created Item information, and ItemID will pull the item image, name, requirements, etc.
- Worked out the basic functioning of the shopping system.
- Created item categories and grouping.

Coming Soon:

- Actual shopping on the website system.
- Auctioning items.
- "Store" pages on the site, players join a store that can be justified to one category of item selling.
- Integration with SMF and Vbulletin forums (view someones shop on their profile)
- Searching through items efficiently.
- Tons of other nice features.

You all can help by letting me know what you think, and providing suggestions if any come to mind. I’m going a bit slower paced as I’m still learning some Java and not fully advanced with it as I am with PHP. Let me know if you have suggestions on ways I could improve the development of this system. - The Web Guy

[size=12pt]I hope to release this to Moparscape as a tutorial in the next month or so.[/size]
